p.s: This report focuses on a cantilever system, whereby a low-level of force is applied and its deflection is detected by gauges and the data is processed as a signal in the form of voltage and be displayed on either analogue or digital displaying device.

Low-level force involved in a cantilever beam system can be measured by Beam-Type Load cells with the use of strain gauges while double ends system can be measured by, Double ended Load Cells, which are similar to Beam-Type Cells.

This report will focus on a cantilever system, in which a Beam-Type Load cells involved and will be looking at how a system made up of strain gauges and Beam- Type Load Cells amplify signals, transmit data to an analogue device and how to digitise data to a digital signal for further processing, displaying and storage.
Before looking at how to make a system work, it is important to understand how this system is expected to work.

To transform analogue signal to digital signal for further processing or other purposes, analogue data is input to a computer system which has integrated or external analogue-to-digital and digital-to-analogue functions.

System designed is to measure low-level force and transmit data as a signal and be displayed.
The processing is mainly done by the strain gauges in the circuit.
A gauge is put on each side of the cantilever.
So when there is a force applied at the end of the cantilever, gauge 1 on the top of the cantilever would experience a tensile strain while gauge 2 on the bottom will be under a compressive strain.
